result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandy Lee Crosby

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Brandy Lee Crosby
Current: 419 North 1st St, New Richmond, WI 54017 United States  (Effective: 10-14-2022)
Prior: PO Box 460, Somerset, WI 54025 
Per change of address form. olg

- $1,000 bond on file.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, M.C..  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping. 

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing [or/and] random ETG testing Mondays and Fridays. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

1:07 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin in court for Brandy Lee Crosby. Defendant Brandy Lee Crosby in court. Includes 22CM588 INIT and 21CM545 STC. 22CM588 INIT: Court informs Defendant of possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Atty Perrin has reviewed complaint with DE. Waive further reading. Enter NG Plea. Bond argument. Court orders bond. Bond continues in 21CM545. Court sets STC. Adjourned
Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Status conference on November 9, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

3:53 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. 21CM454 STC and 22CM588 INIT: Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin in court for Brandy Lee Crosby. Defendant Brandy Lee Crosby appeared by video. 22CM500: Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney John P Bjork in court for Michael Gary Crosby. Defendant Michael Gary Crosby appeared by video.  Court reviews case. 21CM454 and 22CM588: Atty Bjork states victims M.G.C. request for bond modification. Atty Bjork states Victim has no objection to bond modification. Atty Perrin makes bond argument. 22CM588 AIA: Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Atty Perrin has not discussed complaint with DE. Court to continue INIT. Bond argument.  22CM500: ADA Ballo objects to bond modification. Court amends bond. Court sets STC and INIT in case 22CM588. Adjourned 04:12 PM
Initial appearance scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Initial appearance on October 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
